Pre-Game Insights: Marc Brys defended the choice to host the match in Garoua, stating that the Roumdé Adjia Stadium met all the necessary requirements for a quality match.
Goalkeeper André Onana described the team’s reaction as a professional response, stating that they remain professional and have no bias towards the coach’s decision.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last two encounters between the two teams ended in a draw and a victory for Namibia.

The ongoing disputes between FECAFOOT and the government continue to cast a shadow over the proceedings, leaving fans and players alike wondering how these tensions will affect the Indomitable Lions’ performance on the field.
Others: The match was held on Saturday, September 7th, in Garoua.
The decision to host the match in Garoua was initially approved by the country’s Prime Minister, but tensions between FECAFOOT and the government remain unresolved.
